title: How to become an archaeologist, and which subject is supposed to be taken to become an archaeologist - Quora

response.answer_text: A levels aged 18 I took physics Chemistry and maths pure applied, I’m an archaeological scientist I used to be sort of staff at Bradford Uni Dept of Archaeology Sciences , the Prof Mark Pollard very clever guy had a game with the newbie students , you name a science and I’ll say how its relevant in archaeology I have done several school visits, my son’s best friend is the only one to have stumped me - quantum physics , tricky ophalmics zinc oxide was used in India for eyes and is a good medicine recognised today So if higher level sciences can all be valuable then arts subjects can be too best subjects maybe history , RE as it is old culture, geography then its how you want to take it chemistry statistics biology computers are all good
